pal 0.0.9051
  • Reference

List items concatenated in prose style (..., ... and ...)

Source: R/pal-GEN.R
prose_ls.Rd

Takes a vector or list and concatenates its elements to a single string separated in prose-style.

prose_ls(x, wrap = "", separator = ", ", last_separator = " and ")

Arguments

x

A vector or a list.
wrap

The string (usually a single character) in which x is to be wrapped.
separator

The separator to delimit the elements of x.
last_separator

The separator to delimit the second-last and last element of x.

Value

A character scalar.

See also

Other string functions: as_chr(), as_string(), cat_lines(), dsv_colnames(), escape_lf(), fuse_regex(), prettify_nr(), str_replace_file(), str_replace_verbose(), wrap_chr()

Examples

prose_ls(1:5)

#> [1] "1, 2, 3, 4 and 5"
